title.rendered: The Support to Recognition of Professional Qualification-Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Exchange

content.rendered:
The Support to Recognition of Professional Qualification-Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Exchange

The Support to Recognition of Professional Qualification – Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Exchange, stakeholders from Ministry of Education, Science, Technology and Innovation (MESTI) and its Division of Regulated Professions and Legal Department, European Union Office in Kosovo, State Council for the Regulated Professions (SCRP), Ministry of Industry, Entrepreneurship and Trade (MIET), PMO, other line ministries, chambers and relevant stakeholders convene to learn more as per the sharing experiences provided by the experts from Austria, Malta, Latvia and Lithuania.
 
The Peer-to-Peer Exchange , the project aims to build on one another’s successes and challenges to achieve national and continuous growth. P2P exchanges leverage opportunities created when several countries request similar support, want to hear what other countries are doing, or seek to partner across countries to address shared challenges.
 
Four International experts presented their experiences and the current system for RPQ, inter-institutional cooperation, national contact point, database for regulated professions
